result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephanie M. Grosskopf

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 11:00 am. 
INCLUDES: 18CF472 18CF906 18CF920 18CM714 20CF421 20CF1127 22CF173 & 22CF174. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Deft appears from MCJ, and by Atty Chad Shamali. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
18CF472 
Ct.2(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+))>>DRI.

18CF906 
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Battery[Domestic Abuse])>>DRI.
Ct.3(DC[Domestic Abuse])>>DRI.

18CF920 
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Neglecting a Child (Harm Did Not Occur and Child Under 6 Years or Disability))>>DRI.

18CM714 
Ct.1(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+))>>DRI.

20CF421 
Ct.1(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Misd.BJ)>>DRI.

20CF1127 
Ct.1(Retail Theft  Alter Price (<=$500))>>DRI.
Ct.2(Misd.BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.3(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.4 (Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.5(Felony BJ)>>DRI.
Ct.6(Felony BJ)>>DRI.

22CF173 
Ct.1(Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Theft-Movable Property <=$2500/Repeater)>>DRI.

22CF174 
Ct.1(Felony BJ/Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct.2(Criminal Trespass to Dwelling/Repeater)>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
18CF472 
Ct.1(OWI (5th or 6th w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old))>>NO CONTEST. 

20CF421 
Ct.3(Theft-Movable Property <=$2500)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made,  a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: 
18CF472 --
Ct.1>>6 years in WSPS, 2 years IC and 4 years ES.  CONDITIONS of ES:  Pay $1200+CC.  Assessment/Treatment/Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.  AODA and follow through.  Maintain absolute sobriety (with exception of prescribed medication as deemed necessary by agent).  Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 5 years, as is the Defendant him/herself and device to be installed immediately;  IID installation fee to be paid.  5 years DL revocation with any administrative credit.  Provide DNA sample.  
Court grants 52 days credit. 
Court also grants 47 days credit from 22CF174 file to be applied to this one. 
(97 days total).

*****AMENDED 3/31/22 -- JOC to reflect 99 days credit instead of 97 days. ajn.*****

20CF421 --
Ct.3>>SWH for 1 year probation, to run CONCURRENT to 18CF472; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety.  AODA and any follow through.  Pay Restitution in the amount of $663.90 with 10% surcharge.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 
Court grants 24 days credit.

Deft eligible for SAP but not CIP. 

Adj: 11:18 am.

Clerk: Heather.

INCLUDES: 22CF173, 22CF174. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig in person. Defendant appears from MCJ, with Atty Chad Shamali. 
Date and time set for a motion to modify bond hearing.

Atty Shamali recites basis for bond modification request.
ADA Puig recites objection to bond modification request.
COURT makes findings.
COURT denies motion to modify bond.

Dates to remain.

Adjourned: 10:52 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Clerk Amanda
Cases Called at 9:09 am. 
INCLUDES: 18CF472, 22CF173 & 22CF174. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Chad Shamali.  
VRCW. 

Attorney Shamali notes defendant is willing to waive the Prelim in 22CF173 and contest Prelim in 22CF174.
State notes that Prelim in 18CF472 has already had a Prelim.

Waiver of Prelim filed.  
Court questions Defendant as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.

Prelim in 22CF174: 
J.A. sworn and testifies. 

COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial in both matters.  
Information to be E-filed.  R/W; R/J. 

PLEA >> NOT GUILTY;

NEXT DATES:
Plea/Sentencing set for 6/28 at 8:30 am.

Bond Continues;

records.addlTxt: $5,000 signature bond with first $2,500 in cash.  INCLUDES 22CF173 & 22CF174.     No contact with victim(s):  S.W.  or residence.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  No contact with Baymont Inn.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
